I've also had the same problem. I do not do anything out of the ordinary, just simply attempt to create a new BPEL process file. Here is what i've done step by step:

1. Clicked on the "File" menu.
2. Clicked on the "New" menuitem, which opened a submenu.
3. Clicked on the "Other" menuitem.
4. Navigated to the "BPEL 2.0" folder and clicked on "New BPEL Process File" and clicked next
5. Filled out the process details then clicked "Finish"

Here, at the bottom of the dialog box u can see "Creating process from template..." blinks really fast and it goes away and then nothing happens.
Assigning to Michal, as he wrote the wizard code. Michal, any idea what's going on here?

Ahhh, it seems that you have to have a project or a folder within a project *selected* prior to running the wizard to avoid this issue. The selected container determines where the generated wizard files will be placed.

If you open a project, then select any resource within it, then toggle the project in the package explorer or navigator views by clicking on the + of the project, the selection of the inside container will be lost and available as null to the wizard. 

So to walk around this, make sure that a project or folder within a project is first selected before running the wizard.

I'll add page2 to the wizard to select a container in case this happens.
Added the 2nd page to the wizard, removed the null pointer exception condition.
*** Bug 149548 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
